description: Whispers of Prague: wandering cobblestone alleys, secret courtyards and cozy cafés for late-night dreams.

items.name: Charles Bridge – A Stone Gothic Bridge
Prague Castle – The Largest Medieval Complex In Europe
The National Museum – Most Significant Czech Museum Institution
Wenceslas Square – Centre Of The Business And Cultural Communities
The Municipal House – Fine Example Of Nouveau Art
The National Gallery – Features Famous Art Collections
Prague Zoo – Top Zoological Parks In The World
Kutna Hora – Witness The Spectacular Architecture
Old Town Square – The Historic Square
items.description: Old Town Square is among the best places to see in Prague. The historic square is the centre square and attracts tourists from far and wide. The highlight of the place is the famous Prague Astronomical Clock and the Old Town Hall Tower. The market is known worldwide for its Christmas markets and the remarkable Easter. If you're visiting Prague during this time you simply can't afford to miss this.

items.name: The Lennon Wall – Colourful Graffiti, Lyrics And More
Dancing House – Most Photographed Attractions Of Prague
items.description: Dancing House is among Prague's most photographed attractions. The building is used as an office space. Visitors can enjoy an elevated view and drink from its rooftop French restaurant. For the best experience, visit this amazing attraction when the weather is nice. Without a doubt, it is one of the best Prague tourist places.

items.name: Strahov Monastery – For Art Lovers
items.description: If you are looking for unusual places to go in Prague, these remarkable libraries will make a good pick. Located on top of one of Prague's hills, the Strahov Monastery is a must-visit place for art lovers. The interior of the library is worth adoring. It is divided into two halls that contains books of all kinds making it a haven for book lovers.
